shortdesc.ph: Sets the frame position for the video observer.

section.p:
After successfully registering the video data observer, the SDK will use the callback to determine whether to trigger and callback at each specific video frame processing node, so that you can observe the locally collected video data, the video data sent by the remote end, and the video data before encoding. . You can set one or more locations you need to observe by modifying the return value according to the needs of the scene:
POSITION_POST_CAPTURER(1 << 0), the position after the video data is collected locally, corresponding to the callback.
(1 << 1), receiving the position before the video sent by the remote end, corresponding to the callback.
(1 << 2), the position before the local video encoding, corresponds to the callback.

ul.li: Use '|' (the OR operator) to observe multiple frame positions.
This callback observes `POSITION_POST_CAPTURER(1 << 0)` and `POSITION_PRE_RENDERER(1 << 1)` by default.
To conserve the system consumption, you can reduce the number of frame positions that you want to observe.

section.title: Returns
section.p: Set the bit mask: of the observation position.
